articles.title: Rspack 1.0: The Rust-Powered JavaScript Bundler
articles.description: Far from being ‚Äòyet another bundler‚Äô with its own approach and terminology to learn, Rspack prides itself on being webpack API and ecosystem compatible, while offering many times the performance. The team now considers it production ready and encourages you to try your webpack-based projects on it.
articles.author: Rspack Contributors

articles.title: How to Create an NPM Package in 2024
articles.description: Sounds simple, but there are a lot of steps involved if you want to follow best practices, introduce useful tools, and get things just right. Matt Pocock walks through the process here, and there‚Äôs a 14-minute screencast too, if you‚Äôd prefer to watch along.
articles.author: Matt Pocock

articles.title: JS Dates are About to Be Fixed
articles.description: Handling dates and times is famously a painful area for programmers and JavaScript hasn‚Äôt done a lot to make it easier. Libraries like Moment.js help a lot, but Iago looks at how the Temporal proposal and its features will begin to help a lot more over time.
articles.author: Iago Lastra

articles.title: JavaScript Generators Explained
articles.description: Jan was frustrated by the quality of documentation and articles explaining generators in JavaScript, and set out to explain things in a way that a more advanced developer could appreciate.
articles.author: Jan Hesters

articles.title: Implementing a React-a-Like from Scratch
articles.description: While it's unlikely you'll actually want to do this, at least thinking about it can prove instructive as to what‚Äôs going on in React‚Äôs engine room.
articles.author: Robby Pruzan

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†How to Implement the 2048 Game in JavaScript
articles.description: Ania is back with one of her usual easy to follow walkthroughs of implementing a complete game in JavaScript. This time it‚Äôs the 2048 sliding puzzle game. (Two weeks ago she did Tic-Tac-Toe as well.)
articles.author: Ania Kub√≥w

articles.title: TypeScript 5.6 Release Candidate
articles.description: As always, Daniel presents an epic roundup of what‚Äôs new. We‚Äôll focus more on it next week though, as the final release is anticipated to land next Tuesday (September 3).
articles.author: Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

articles.title: Vuestic UI 1.10: A Vue.js 3.0 UI Framework
articles.description: Features 60 customizable and responsive components and with the v1.10 release it‚Äôs gained a significant bundle size optimization, a custom compiler that improves build time performance, and other minor enhancements. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Vuestic UI

articles.title: Material¬†UI v6: The Popular React UI Design/Component System
articles.description: At ten years old, the popular design system has its latest major release. There's a focus on improved theming, color scheme management, container queries, and React 19 support. There are revamped templates to be inspired by, too.
articles.author: Garc√≠a, Bittu, Andai, et al.

articles.title: npm-check-updates 17.0: Update package.json Dependencies to Latest Versions
articles.description: That is, as opposed to the specified versions. It includes a handy -i interactive mode so you can look at potential upgrades and then opt in to them one by one.
articles.author: Raine Revere

articles.title: Code Hike 1.0: Turn Markdown into Rich Interactive Experiences
articles.description: Aimed at use cases like code walkthroughs and interactive docs, Code Hike bridges the gap between Markdown and React when creating technical content that takes full advantage of the modern web.
articles.author: Rodrigo Pombo

articles.title: Calendar.js: A Calendar Control with Drag and Drop
articles.description: A responsive calendar with no dependencies, full drag and drop support (even between calendars), and many ways to manage events with recurring events, exporting, holidays, and more.
articles.author: William Troup

articles.description: ü§ñ v0 is an AI-powered tool from Vercel for, originally, generating shadcn/ui-powered React components based upon prompts you supply. Now, however, it has basic Vue.js support too.

Deno 1.46 has been released and promises to be the final 1.x release before the much awaited Deno 2.0. Deno's Node compatibility improves even more (it now supports Playwright and many more things) and ships with V8 12.9.
üìä IEEE has published its latest annual list of top programming languages. JavaScript takes third place, but TypeScript has leapt up several places to fourth.
Prisma 5.19 ‚Äì The popular ORM for Node.js and TypeScript adds 'TypedSQL', a way to write raw SQL queries in a type-safe way.
üìà billboard.js 3.13 ‚Äì Popular D3 chart library adds area-step-range charts.
pnpm 9.9 ‚Äì Fast, space efficient package manager.
React Email 3.0, Ember 5.11, Bun v1.1.26

articles.title: The State of CSS 2024 Survey
articles.description: The increased pace of evolution in the CSS space seems to show no signs of slowing, as such we can now do so much more than we could just a few short years ago (be that advanced math, scroll-triggered animations, etc). As such, this recently launched survey ‚Äî which covers things like layout, color, typography, accessibility, and more ‚Äî plays an important role in letting browser vendors know what we all think about the path CSS is taking. Be sure to fill it out, and tell em we sent ya. üòâ
articles.author: Devographics

articles.title: How to Make Your Web Page Faster Before It Even Loads
articles.description: Can we measure the events that happen before the first byte of a web page is received by the browser, and in turn optimize them to make our web pages and apps load even faster?
articles.author: Salma Alam-Naylor

articles.title: Can You Convert a Video to Pure CSS?
articles.description: Can or should..? A highly detailed exploration of using scroll-based animations as a way to play video as just CSS. David has also made a neat browser-based tool for converting any video into a pure CSS keyframe animation ready to be dropped into your site.
articles.author: David Gerrells

articles.title: blocking=render: Why Would You Do That?!
articles.description: Harry stresses that unless you know you need this behavior, you don‚Äôt need it.
articles.author: Harry Roberts

articles.title: Custom Range Slider Using Anchor Positioning & Scroll-Driven Animations
articles.description: It‚Äôs still a touch early to truly adopt these two features (only Chrome and Edge have full support today), but it can‚Äôt hurt to explore both Anchor positioning and scroll-driven animations to get an overview of just what could be done in the near future ‚Äì it's a nifty effect!
articles.author: Temani Afif

articles.title: üôà Spoiler Alert: It Needs to Be Accessible
articles.description: Here‚Äôs what Scott would expect from a would-be spoiler component, ‚Äúif someone were to build one, or if one were to ever be standardized‚Äù.
articles.author: Scott O'Hara

articles.title: Basic Keyboard Shortcut Support for Focused Links
articles.description: Turns out there‚Äôs a lot of different actions you can perform via the keyboard when an anchor element is focused.
articles.author: Eric Bailey

articles.title: Double Your Specificity with This One Weird Trick
articles.description: A bit of a hack, sure, but by doubling up the relevant selector(s) you can boost your specificity without resorting to overrides or using !important.
articles.author: James Nash

articles.title: Five WASM Use Cases for Frontend Development
articles.description: WebAssembly is gaining ground in frontend development, so how should you consider applying it?
articles.author: Eleanor Hecks

articles.title: Elastic Overflow Scrolling
articles.description: Creating a CSS-only ‚Äúrubber band‚Äù scrolling effect.
articles.author: Dave Seidman

articles.title: Tagger: Zero Dependency, Vanilla JavaScript Tagging Library
articles.description: You can play with a live demo here.
articles.author: Jakub T. Jankiewicz

articles.title: Web Vitals: Chrome Extension for Instant Feedback on Loading, Interactivity and Layout Shift Metrics
articles.description: Includes support for all of the Core Web Vitals.
articles.author: Addy Osmani

articles.title: Replace Twitter (X) Embeds with Semantic HTML
articles.description: A Python script for converting a public Tweet into embedded, semantic HTML.
articles.author: Terence Eden

articles.title: The Monospace Web
articles.description: A well formed, minimalist CSS design exploration, featuring lists, tables, charts, ASCII drawings, etc.
articles.author: Oskar Wickstr√∂m

articles.title: Fuite 5.0: A Tool for Finding Memory Leaks in Web Apps
articles.description: A CLI tool that you can point at a URL to analyze for memory leaks. Here‚Äôs how it works. There‚Äôs also a video tutorial.
articles.author: Nolan Lawson

articles.title: Milkdown: Plugin-Driven WYSIWYG Markdown Editor Framework
articles.description: A lightweight WYSIWYG Markdown editor based around a plugin system that enables a significant level of customization. It‚Äôs neat to see the docs are rendered by the editor itself. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Mirone

articles.title: heic-to: Convert HEIC/HEIF Images to JPEG or PNG In-Browser
articles.description: HEIF is a modern container format for storing images but is frequently unsupported by many tools, so converting supplied HEIF images to more popular formats could be useful.
articles.author: Hopper Gee
